tec-powered supplements: With the help of 3D printing technology, people can create their own personalized supplements that contain all the essential vitamins and minerals needed for a healthy diet. These supplements can be tailored to an individual's specific needs and preferences, making it a convenient and effective way to maintain a balanced diet.

Plant-based protein powders: If fruits and vegetables disappear, people can still get essential vitamins and minerals by consuming plant-based protein powders. These powders are made from a variety of plant-based sources such as soy, hemp, and pea, and are fortified with essential vitamins and minerals to provide a complete nutritional profile.

Fermented foods: Fermented foods such as kimchi, sauerkraut, and yogurt are rich in probiotics and other beneficial microorganisms that can help support a healthy gut microbiome. These foods also contain essential vitamins and minerals that can help maintain overall health and wellness.

Algae-based supplements: Algae such as spirulina and chlorella are rich in essential vitamins and minerals, including vitamin A, vitamin C, and iron. These supplements can be taken in the form of capsules or powders and are a sustainable and eco-friendly alternative to traditional animal-based sources of protein.

Fortified cereals and oatmeal: Many cereals and oatmeal brands now include added vitamins and minerals to help people meet their daily nutritional needs. These products can be a convenient and easy way to get essential nutrients, especially for those who may not have access to a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables.
